description:
REPORTS TO: President, Cass Commercial Bank

FUNCTION:

The Director, Business Development, in collaboration with business-line directors, develops, executes, and maintains marketing strategies to meet organizational objectives and support profitable business growth. This position is responsible for the development and execution of the bank's annual marketing plan and budget, as well as leading all marketing efforts including research and development; creation of innovative marketing campaigns; brand management; content development; advertising; event management; website; charitable giving; and marketing automation tools. Additionally, the Director, Business Development is responsible for creating new business lines and will also act as a Sr. Relationship Manager for select key clients.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
• Working with the Bank President, Chief Credit Officer, and business-line directors, establishes marketing goals to ensure share of market, profitability of products/services, and deepening of existing client relationships.
• Develops and executes quarterly/annual marketing plan and budget in accordance with overall business objectives and goals.
• Applies knowledge of the sales process to generate ideas for new content and serves as a point of contact to Relationship Managers for product information.
• Develops and maintains relationships with external service providers to facilitate marketing campaigns and overall branding, including copy, design, layout, and production of all content.
• Negotiates pricing and proposals with all third-party vendors as needed.
• Prepares marketing reports and general updates for management.
• Determines the strategy and distribution of charitable giving from the budgeted funds allocated to the bank for such purposes.
• Remains fully versed in new marketing tools, techniques and strategies that can be leveraged by the bank to gain competitive advantages in the markets we serve.
• Maintains a portfolio of select clients, performing duties of a Sr. Relationship Manager, including processing and servicing loans, conducting complex credit analysis, and providing advice and counsel to clients.
• Develops and executes plans to create additional lines of business to increase profitability.
• Leads assigned team members to support overall strategy.
• Performs special projects as requested.
• Other duties as needed or assigned.

SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
• High level of accountability; willing to take ownership and solve problems.
• Strong desire to work with people and accomplish objectives through the efforts of others.
• Team player that understands success rests on helping other to be successful.
• Able to motivate others and create a positive work environment where employees feel comfortable discussing issues and concerns.
• Experience in sales and marketing systems (Salesforce, Pardot, Word Press, etc.) preferred.
• Effective communication skills including excellent listening skills and the ability to communicate professionally with all levels of an organization both verbally and in writing.
• A high level of analytical skills to conduct complex and strategic analysis and convey that understanding both internally and with clients.

MINIMUM LEVEL OF PREPARATION AND TRAINING NORMALLY REQUIRED:
• A technical level of knowledge normally acquired through completion of advances studies or special developmental/educational executive programs in business administration, finance and marketing or equivalent experience.
• 5+ years of experience in all aspects of developing and implementing targeted marketing strategies.

3. 10+ years of progressively increasing responsibility for commercial lending including credit underwriting and loan documentation or equivalent experience

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)
